Reviews.Title: “Smaller Drury Inn on north side of Indy”
Reviews.Author: MSUmindy
Reviews.Content: This Drury is a very small property. It is very well maintained overall, although the carpeting in our room was a bit worn in the doorways. These rooms are smaller than the newer Drury Inns, so the bathroom was very small, although adequate. The bed was OK, but not the most comfortable of our trip, and we stayed in 4 different Drury's during our travels this time. The breakfast area is quiet small, as is the business area. They still serve the ill compliment of hot evening foods, beverages, and breakfast. The serving area is small compared to some other Drury's. The staff was fabulous, as always. Helpful, friendly, courteous, in all capacities. The room was clean. A few things were found bothersome, which may be picky, but there was not a recliner chair in the room and the TV remote would not consistently work. Also, they only have an outdoor pool, which is oly open in the summer months. Very small exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn - Good every time!”
Reviews.Author: musicguy8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Drury Inn in Indianapolis because it is close to Beef and Boards, a dinner and broadway show. We used our drury points so the room was free! The hotel is on the northwest side of indy. Probably, 20-25 minutes from downtown. Check-in was very easy and staff was very polite! Room was a little smaller than most drurys i have stayed in, as well as the bathroom! You could tell this was one of the older drury's. However, the hotel was perfect for a one night get-a-way. The free breakfast was excellent! There was an outdoor pool, but no indoor pool. THE STAFF MEMBERS AT THIS HOTEL ARE EXCELLENT! They made sure we had everything we needed and always asked if there was something they could do. Drury Inn's have the hotel business figured out. Huge fan!

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn Was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kris Y
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a hotel for the night on our way home. We had just bought a puppy, so we needed something that was pet friendly. I googled pet friendly hotels and pulled up the Drury Inn. I called and the receptionist was incredibly nice. I reserved a room and when we checked in it was very quick and easy, They were just wonderful about the puppy and she insisted to see her. She gave us a voucher for 3 free mixed drinks at the bar and they were serving snacks that were very good. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Everyone member of the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. I can honestly say overall it was my best hotel experience yet and I travel quite a bit with my business. After this excellent experience, I will definitely patronize Drury Inns in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: nwmsu
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated, the benefits are the free popcorn, pop, breakfast, dinner (in my book) and drinks at night. The room was acceptable and the bed was comfy for my liking. Staff was friendly, especially the bartender and staff at the evening reception. I cannot remember their names but both ladies had a great sense of humor and were professionally social. You cannot go wrong with Drury Inn's. If I am in Indianapolis again, I would consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mavid79
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. I was asked about a location preference. When I said I wanted some place quiet, they found a great spot for me. They have a nice cocktail hour with decent food. The breakfast was very good. I've stayed at several Drury Inns and this one had the best staff. My only complaint is that the mattress in my room was very soft and I prefer a firmer mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jpatridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in January. Very close to where I needed to be and plenty of restaurants around that are of decent calibur. Rooms were clean, lobby was nice. Breakfast was good, the cocktail hour wass nice and had decent food. I don't know how much the room was as I was on a company trip, but it seemed like a good value. My only complaint was the room....very bright at night time and nothing I could do about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - Our regular stay in Indy”
Reviews.Author: Marko_R_12
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel when our son started college in Indianapolis five years ago. Now he lives in Indy and we continue to stay here when we visit. We've never had a bad experience. Extended families also stayed there when our son graduated last May. All were quite pleased. A nice hotel and a good value. Since we started going there five years ago they've remodeled the lobby and breakfast area, and also refreshed the rooms. They are comfortable and quiet. It's nice to have a split bathroom, with toilet/shower in a separate room from the sink/mirror area. Some rooms are around an open area exposed to the lobby below, so I've had concern there could be a noise problem. But we've never been disturbed by it. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. I enjoy chatting with the gal who runs the breakfast buffet. She keeps the items fresh and is there to help if there's a problem. A nice variety of hot items (eggs, sausage, french toast, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal) and two do-it-yourself wafflemakers (improved newer ones when we last visited). Also a variety of fruits, breads, donuts, and cereals. There is also an evening snack and drinks until 7PM, and popcorn (my favorite) until 10PM. There's convenient access to I-465 on the northwest side of the city. Only 15 minutes to the Butler campus or to Downtown. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “House keeping Loud! Dirty Bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: We got there late asked to stay till noon they obliged us..House keepers were Banging loudly and squeeking something in the room keeping us from sleeping started around 7:30am and did not stop till we left! The room had a clump of slimy hair on the Faucet handle! Terrible experience! We complained and they Comped us the room good thing i guess..We still did not get any sleep! Called Regional Manager Got no satisfaction . Said most of the rooms were empty that night.. Had nothing to do with the Housekeeper not letting us get any sleep.. Third time we stayed at a Drury Inn..Similar problems with all Three...Go somewhere else! Name sayes it all When you leave you will be Drury. or is that Drowsy.

Reviews.Title: “A bit below average”
Reviews.Author: EECS
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: I would stay elsewhere. A number of things made the hotel unattractive. Check in was literally 15 seconds and check out was unnecessary. Front desk and the breakfast crew do a great job with service. Customer service is very good and clearly a high priority. Unfortunately, the hotel is lacking. The king bed room was just a bit small. For example, the distance from the tub to the counter in the bathroon is the width of the door. The TV is just a bit large for the room. The desk is more of a writing desk than a work area and is about half the depth that is comfortable. The bed was uncomfortable. Too firm with little cushion. Flushing the toilet created a very loud whine while filling (a minute at least). There was a low hum that kept me awake until about 1am. I assume it was either the HVAC or a truck idling in the parking lot. I was on the road side and was up about 5:30am because of the traffic noise. I was down stairs at about 8:15am for breakfast. My electronics were not with me and I was hoping to use the hotel computer. Unfortunately, someone was camped on the 1 computer I saw. Breakfast was terrible. I assume it was because of the time of day. Biscuits and gravy: hard biscuit and off tasting gravy. I settled for organic granola, a mini Yoplait yogurt, and coffee. The granola was very good and the coffee tasted burned and very acidic. Perhaps a 1 off, but I will not stay at this location again. There is a Drury Inn & Suites across town. I would assume that would be a little more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in a safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Travel_and_Learn99
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel with Holiday Inn type of quality. Staff were nice. Breakfast food and evening happy hour snacks were good. Around the neighborhood, there is some restaurants and a Costco store. The location is about 10 miles from downtown and easy to get to, pretty much going straight on North Michigan St.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good food”
Reviews.Author: CinziaOrchard
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Drury Inn Hotel northeast of Indianapolis for 5 days while attending a convention. We chose the hotel because of its relative convenience to the Indiana State Fairgrounds, where the convention was being held, and because it provided both a full breakfast and a light supper. The hotel is comfortable -- good beds, nice service. The rooms are standard, the beds comfortable. There are not a lot of extras in the rooms, but there is free internet, plus a refrigerator. I believe the real reason people stay here is for the food. The full breakfast is quite good - scrambled eggs, oatmeal, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, doughnuts, etc. It doesn't seem to vary much, which is fine. In the evening, from 5:30 - 7:00, there is provided what they call a "Kick Back." This was easily a meal for my daughter and me, plus most of the other people at the hotel. There were always good baked potatoes, lettuce, carrots and celery, chips, and hot dogs. In addition, there was always something else: hamburger mix and refried beans for nachos or to go on the baked potatoes, chicken nuggets, or spicy chicken, macaroni & chees, chili, and/or cream of broccoli soup. If we could arrange our schedule to be at the hotel during "Kick Back," we didn't have to go out to eat. As for the position of the hotel, it is right next to a busy freeway. The freeway noise could be disturbing to a light sleeper. If that is the case, request a room on the side of the hotel away from the freeway. Our room was on the noisy side, but it didn't bother us. If my schedule were to allow me to always be at the hotel at dinner time, I would choose the Drury Inn over other similar hotel chains.,. If not, I would choose the Drury only if it were convenient to my location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: rpggal
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Indianapolis marathon, and the hotel went out of it's way to accommodate the needs of the runners. Extra bananas were on hand, healthy breakfast choices that were laid out earlier than normal, since we needed to leave early, and late check out options, to allow for a trip back and a quick shower. Went over the top to provide excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Carlynn
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in 2 Drury Inns in different cities over the past year, and booked my extended family into the Indianapolis hotel based on my good impressions. It was a very important trip, as my mother is newly handicapped and assuming she can't do anything anymore - including travel. We needed to have things go as smoothly as possible for her to get her confidence back. Thus the extra care in choosing SWA, probably the last airline to consider passenger care a priority, and the Drury Inn, both for location and my experience with them. I just can't thank the Indy Drury Inn enough for their graciousness. Everything I knew of them as a chain, plus the extra of great staff training. Family members were all arriving at different times, but the desk was aware of the group. Everyone working there treated my mother like royalty without fawning over her handicap. In fact, the family voted to cancel the next night's lodging in a different city and drive back to this Drury instead. Like a restaurant with a gorgeous view, hotels that offer a good bang for the buck don't really have to be more than that to get business. This Drury Inn offered the freebies AND the quality: bedrooms were clean, beds were luxurious, lobby was inviting and the staff was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay During the MOTO GP RACE!”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for 4 nights during the MOTO GP Motorcycle races. Staff was very friendly and the Hotel was Clean, Safe (with Night Security guarding the over 100 Ducati Owners Motorcycles in the lot). The food at Breakfast and during Happy Hour was great and hit the spot while enjoying the free drinks. The Front Desk Staff, Breakfast and Happy Hour Staff, and Housekeeping Staff were all very professional and made everyone's stay enjoyable. I have been to races at Indy three times, and would definitely stay here again. THANKS TO THE STAFF, KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!

Reviews.Title: “Drury is the best”
Reviews.Author: punkinlr
Reviews.Content: If you've read any of my other reviews about Drury Inn's, this will be redundant. In our opinion Drury offers the best for less. From the outstanding staff to the hot breakfast there is nothing to complain about. We love their nightly "kick-back" and the complimentary soft drinks and popcorn. The rooms are very clean and spacious, and the bed provides a great nights sleep. Each Drury we have stayed in has been quiet. Not sure what their magic is to keep doors from slamming, but it works.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value! Where else do you get a hot breakfast for free?!”
Reviews.Author: CJKreport
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. I found this hotel to be very comfortable, affordable, and the staff to be very courteous!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: No frills here, but a basic reliable hotel experience. The rooms are on the small side and mine was quite dark due to a single small window, so there wasn't much natural light. The bathroom was small and cramped. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The hotel features an evening happy hour with hot food (nachos, hot dogs), snacks and complimentary beer/wine or limited cocktails (max of 3 drinks). The free hot breakfast was average. These are the same things you get at an Embassy Suites or Staybridge, but the rooms here are much smaller and somewhat cheaper. Staff were friendly and helpful. A good value in a convenient location just off I-465 at Michigan Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: chicagoretired
Reviews.Content: Right off the highway, easy trip downtown right down Michigan Road. Drury Inns really get it right. Nice food spread at 5:30 PM daily. Only problem was the blanket on bed needed to be upgraded as it had holes.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: familytravlerchicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right off the highway. Easy to find. Good restaurants near by. The room was big and clean, the bed was very comfortable, The snacks and drinks were a great way to end a long drive. The young man assisting the bar tender went out of his way to print up directions to the venue we were attending. Great service!! Would definitly stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: breonnabreonna
Reviews.Content: I have been to worst hotels by far. Its decent for the price. If you are just looking for an average clean hotel then this is it. They have internet in the room and a lot of lighting (if needed) in the rooms so that's a plus. The price goes with the quality.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Choice for State Fair every year !!!”
Reviews.Author: kyantis23
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and can't say enough good things about them. The rooms are super clean,the service is fast & excellent,the breakfast is great @ no extra charge,the pool is clean,everything is wonderful. We return there every year for a week long stay for State Fair and get 2 ajoined rooms and even better they are also pet friendly which is a BIG +,since we take cats to state fair. Big Thanks to everyone @ The Drury Inn. You make our stay great in every way :-)

Reviews.Title: “They like dogs a lot! Nice place! But why didn't the AC work?”
Reviews.Author: RobertSmithies
Reviews.Content: The Indianapolis Drury Inn is a nice place, with a friendly staff that is very very dog friendly - the front desk insisted that we bring our pups by to say hello. So five stars for that (nice place, happy dogs, breakfast, overall being better than expectations). But the room AC didn't work (as mentioned by others here), and it was a little stuffy during the night - so, if that matters more to you, you can give it four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice”
Reviews.Author: SGW83
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here twice on this same trip. Once at the beginning of our 2 week tour and once at the end. The first stay was not so good. Our air conditioning in the room was broken and the room was 59 degrees all night. We also did not have a bedspread.....it was just a weird night. However, our second stay was much better. We had a bedspread the A/C worked properly. However, be leary of the rooms over the atrium. We had a large NOISY crowd in the lobby at 5 am. Drury Inns did not rank at the top of our hotel stays and we stayed in many on this trip. They are OK. Some cities have very nice ones. This one is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sonofpaul78
Reviews.Content: This is an ordinary hotel with extraordinary staff and customer service. I expect the kind of personal attention we got here from a place like the St. Regis in Shanghai, but the Drury in Zionsville? Highly recommended just for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: taulbmi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the hotel website and got a $70 per night internet rate, which is great value for the quality. The hotel is located 15 minutes from downtown, but is surrounded by plenty of restaurants and shopping (actually is right next to Cracker Barrel). We did not take part in the evening reception, but it appeared from walking through the lobby that the other guest enjoyed it. The free hot breakfast is a nice advantage, and it was kept well stocked. This hotel accepts pets, which did not bother me, but there was noticeable dog hair on the rugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Beds are Comfy Too!”
Reviews.Author: 4KIDSMOM69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn on Sept. 29, 2007 while in town for a wedding. Very nice hotel. Very clean, great breakfast, and the beds were actually very comfy. My dad even took the tag off the matteress to see if he could order one for his bed. The only thing that irritated me was when we checked in for the block of rooms the bride and groom had reserved for us, the desk clerk "forgot" to give us one of the gift bags that the bride and groom had left for the out of town guests. By the time I found out and asked for mine, they were all gone. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TNTruckDriver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Drury twice. I have not had a problem either time, and have had a clean room with very nice amenities. The cocktail reception and breakfast are great. I just wish that it had an indoor pool like many of the Drurys have. I don't even need to call around in Indy, this is the only place I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-price hotel, pet-friendly, and HOT breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: CUTripping
Reviews.Content: This is in the family of Hampton Inn but at Super8 prices. This was our first stay at a Drury Inn (we usually stay at Super8 or other similar hotels). We initially stayed because the price with two dogs was the same as Super8 (which had a per pet per night fee) compared to pets staying FREE at Drury, but Drury has a full hot breakfast (eggs, sausage, biscuits, gravy, Fr. toast, waffles, juice, coffee and cereal, too). And, there's the FREE evening snacks and sodas, FREE long distance calling, and other "extras that aren't extras." Then we found the room to be exceptional! The king bed is pillow-top (not too soft, not too hard -- just right and comfy). The fridge and microwave are hidden in the TV wall cabinet. The shower rod is bowed out and the shower liner magnetically attaches to the tub to prevent the liner from grabbing people. The next best thing is the friendly staff -- with friendly greetings and willing helpfulness. It was a VERY enjoyable stay. The hotel is located directly between two restaurants and we worried about the noise from the deliveries and garbage pickup or the major six-lane road in front but were pleasantly surprised that we heard neither due to the building's soundproofness. We will definitely stay here again and will look for other Drury Hotels when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: hby
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights while in Indianapolis on business. Check in was fast and friendly. The room was typical for this type of hotel. The evening snacks and drinks were a nice touch. Breakfast was eggs, sausage, waffles, french toast, plus the normal items like cerealNice lobby area/breakfast area. Outside appearance was nice. Hotel is in between a Bob Evan's and a Cracker Barrell. A Ruby Tuesday's and a Texas Roadhouse are located across the street (about a two block walk). Wired Internet connection was fast and easy to use. Should I return to this area in the future, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “By the Pyramids on Michigan Rd.”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomma
Reviews.Content: Adequate, but had a huge problem with the breakfast area the next morning: the "hostess" was so busy helping people with the waffle iron that the "buffet" was out of food and silverware and the place was unkempt with trash. When the hostess finally went to refill the food, she was licking her fingers. I didn't go back for refills. Also - not the hotel's fault - kids were running around like crazy in the eating area, sticking their hands in some kind of "pond" - with some of them barefoot. UGH! My sister has stayed there with a good internet special and businessmen at breakfast and had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-friendly and CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Veghead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading TripAdvisor reviews and weren't disappointed. The rooms and common areas were clean and the staff was efficient. Freebies like breakfast and evening snacks were a nice extra. We had no complaints--we'll check out other hotels in this chain and hope they're all this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Something Extra!”
Reviews.Author: sxs0797
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I really enjoyed staying at this Drury Inn in Indianapolis. We have never stayed at any Drury Inn before, and after this experience we wonder why we did not try here before Holiday Inn, Ramada, Court Yard, Best Western etc. We stayed here for 4 night in March. The building may be a little bit old, but the room is very clean! Our non-smoking room was quiet (this is very important to us!). The bed was big enough. The staff was friendly. It is located within the walking distance from Cracker Barrel, Bob Evans and other restaurants. Good hot breakfast - waffel, scramble egg, sausage, gravy with biscuit (it was the same during our entire stay). Unlike some other hotels, this one has a large breakfast room. What we liked so much about Drury Inn were free snacks and drinks from 5PM-7PM, free popcorn and soft drinks in the room, and free one hour long distance call! If we ever return to Indianapolis, we will go back there for SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Automobile break-ins”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was told to be park in the reary parking lot to be near my room. My car was broke into with window broke out and stereo ripped out doing alot of financial damage. I notified the hotel manager only to be told they will not be responsible for any damages to my car. When the police came to make a report I informed that it just happened to another person the evening prior to the day I checked in. The hotel was totally aware of it and did not warn me about parking in the rear. I feel that sending a woman alone to the back parking lot could of been alot more serious than just my car being burglarized. If this doesn't get posted I will post it on another website. People should be warned of such risks! I also did the customer survey to report it and nobody has contacted me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamzoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while I was in Indianapolis for business. Great hotel. Staff very friendly, room was very clean and the high speed internet worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and special amenities”
Reviews.Author: SageTraveling
Reviews.Content: A nice clean place for as low as $70/night. Three free drinks in evening (wine, beer, or liquor/mixed) with nachos/cheese/salsa/jalapenos chexmix snacks. Hot breakfast changes daily (eggs, sausage, waffles, biscuits/gravy, french toast, danish/doughnuts, cereals, fruit, juices, coffee.....) Free long distance (1 hr) was nice but line quality was not so good. Free soft drinks and popcorn in room. Very nice staff. Many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a road trip. The room was a decent size with floor to ceiling windows. The free drinks and nachos at check in was nice too. Bathroom was a little "old" but other than that, a good place for the money

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: mmaskill
Reviews.Content: I travel for business all over the midwest. I frequently stay in the Indianapolis area. The Drury Inn is the only hotel I stay anymore. The staff treats all of it's customers professionaly and courteously (whether first time or repeat), you can always count on a nice, clean, comfortable room, and the extra services they offer are outstanding (1 hour free long distance, the complimentary refreshments in the evening and the near flawless high speed internet.) Outside of the lack of an indoor pool and fitness area, this hotel is a great place to stay. I have stayed there for up to three days on business and felt absolutely at home at the Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Value + service = repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: mwkeiki
Reviews.Content: I picked the Drury for a "boys weekend" with my two young sons. In addition to the amenities listed by the previous reviewer, it is next door to a "family" restaurant and only a short stroll to several others. High speed internet worked flawlessly. I was quite pleased with the comfort of the place for families with young children. The only "hitch" was that we were put in a room across the elevator, which did not seem like a big deal until early in the morning, when I was rousted by a buzzing sound that kept repeating every 10 minutes or so. After clearing my head I realized that it was the elevator (which I hadn't noticed earlier). It was annoying, but since we were there only for a night, I chalked it up to a lesson learned (never stay in a room next to or across an elevator). Several days later, I received a customer satisfaction survey via email. I noted the elevator incident (not as a complaint, just as information) but noted that I was a happy customer. Within a day I recieved an email from the manager saying she had credited me for the cost of the stay, saying that "a good night's sleep" should be part of their service. Wow! THAT'S never happened before! Will definitely be staying there again when in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at this hotel while in Indianapolis on business and loved every minute of it. I drove every day to downtown Indianapolis to attend a conference and looked forward to returning to the hotel to sit back and relax; Drury made it easy to do so. I loved the free snacks and drinks in the evening, free continental breakfast in the morning (I cannot wait until they get their Hot! Quickstart Breakfast at this hotel), free soda and popcorn in my room (with more available at no charge from the desk), free high speed internet and the free one hour long distance phone call every evening. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the television was great (25" with three HBO channels). The staff was very friendly and very helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Drury Inn Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 9320 N Michigan Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46268
